results.authors: By Jack Farchy and Benjamin Bain
results.headline: Trafigura to Pay $55 Million Over Fuel Oil Manipulation
results.summary: Trafigura Group agreed to pay $55 million to settle allegations from the US Commodity Futures Trading Commission that it manipulated a fuel oil benchmark and blocked employees from cooperating with regulators.

results.headline: China Needs a Green Marshall Plan for the Global South
results.summary: If Beijing is serious about building mutual alliances abroad, it should try and emulate America’s postwar initiative.

results.authors: By Anders Melin, Eliza Ronalds-Hannon, and Reshmi Basu
results.headline: Red Lobster Looks to New Wall Street Savior After Woes
results.summary: Barbs immediately began to fly after Red Lobster filed for bankruptcy last month.

results.authors: By Bruna Lessa, Beatriz Reis, and Simone Iglesias
results.headline: Brazil’s Fernando Haddad Says Lula Meeting Touched on Balancing Budget
results.summary: Brazil Finance Minister Fernando Haddad said he had a productive meeting with President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva on Monday regarding the crucial evolution of public expenditures and tax waivers.

results.authors: By Christopher Charleston, Tarso Veloso, and David R Baker
results.headline: Five Key Charts to Watch in Global Commodities This Week
results.summary: Beef fat from Brazil is finding its way into American biofuels as US processors look abroad for cheaper raw materials. Often-overlooked manganese is outshining other commodities this year. And the world is awash with electric car batteries — a situation that threatens to undermine future demand.

results.authors: By Rachel Gamarski, Felipe Saturnino, and Maria Eloisa Capurro
results.headline: Brazil Central Bank Faces Self-Inflicted Crisis
results.summary: Brazil’s central bank is facing an emergency of its own making that threatens to sabotage years of deft policy making and credibility gains.

results.headline: When Will America Get Its $25,000 Electric Car?
results.summary: Here’s what we know about the ultra-affordable EVs in development from Tesla, General Motors, Ford and Stellantis.

results.headline: Fraud Police Probing Ex-Glencore Staff Plan to Press Charges
results.summary: British prosecutors investigating former Glencore Plc employees over bribery allegations said they plan to bring long-awaited criminal charges.

results.headline: Stellantis, Champion of Home Work, Asks Engineers Back to Office
results.summary: Stellantis NV has sent its auto engineers back to the office, reversing a policy that Chief Executive Officer Carlos Tavares has used to cut expenses at a company that championed home working in the wake of the pandemic.

results.authors: By Andrea Palasciano and Bastian Benrath
results.headline: Ukraine’s Global Outreach Hits Wall as Summit Goals Fall Short
results.summary: Volodymyr Zelenskiy is returning to Kyiv with €50 billion ($53.5 billion) in aid, fresh security guarantees from the US and commitments to help rebuild energy infrastructure for a country battered by more than two years of war.
